data.headline: Dow futures down around 0.3%, S&P 500 off 0.2–0.25%, Nasdaq futures lower by 0.1–0.2%, and Russell 2000 weaker in premarket trade
bullets: Markets remain cautious ahead of the pivotal January CPI release expected at 8:30 AM ET (+0.3% MoM, +2.5% YoY consensus)
Recent sharp tech-led selloff, driven by AI sector weakness, continues to weigh on sentiment
Spillover selling pressure noted in trucking and real estate sectors following Thursday's declines
Traders remain wary of sticky inflation, uncertain Fed rate-cut timing, and potential government shutdown risks
Equity outflows and persistent AI-related fears add to market caution
Few fresh earnings catalysts, with earlier moves in Applied Materials, Rivian, Airbnb, SEI, DraftKings, Pinterest, and Expedia already digested
